constituent: endure, blade, sword, dagger, drop, heart
heisigStory: Blade . . . heart. Endure here means long-suffering patience.
koohiiStory1: A ninja must be able to endure the pain of clinging to a ceiling, motionless, for hours at a time, waiting for just the right moment to drop down and thrust the blade of his sword into the hearts of his enemies. By the way, this character is used in the compound 忍者 (ninja) which is why I choose to use ninja as its primitive meaning.
koohiiStory2: Someone with a razor blade stuck in their heart has to endure the pain wherever they go and can tell no one about it.
myStory: nhẫn nhịn. lưỡi dao trên tim
readingExamples: 忍ばせる (しの.ばせる), 忍ぶ (しの.ぶ)
